required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anaemetro I.V. Infusion 500mg Drug Use Investigation

brief_summary.textblock: Secondary Data Collection Study; safety and effectiveness of Anaemetro under Japanese medical practice

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion in a participant who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion. A serious ADR was an ADR resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was assessed by the physician.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response of ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was evaluated comprehensively at the completion of the observation period, being assessed as "effective," "not effective," or "indeterminate" by the physician based on clinical symptoms. Clinical response rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants evaluated as "effective" over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response Rates by Target Diseases
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response of ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was evaluated comprehensively at the completion of the observation period, being assessed as "effective," "not effective," or "indeterminate" by the physician based on clinical symptoms. Clinical response rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants evaluated as "effective" over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Participants assessed as "effective" by the following target diseases were counted to assess whether they contribute to the clinical response: anaerobic infection, infectious enterocolitis, amebic dysentery, and the infection with both infectious enterocolitis and amebic dysentery.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who satisfy all of the inclusion criteria are subject to this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have not used metronidazole (injection) in the past, and have been given this drug for treatment of anaerobic infection, infectious enterocolitis, or amebic dysentery. Patients who have used metronidazole (oral agent and vaginal tablet) in the past are eligible, and should not be excluded from this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No exclusion criteria are set out in this study.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

group.title: ANAEMETRO Intravenous Infusion (Metronidazole)
group.description: Participants who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of maximum 8 weeks. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

baseline.population: A total of 107 participants were enrolled in this study. There was no participant excluded from the baseline analysis.

group.title: ANAEMETRO Intravenous Infusion (Metronidazole)
group.description: Participants who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of maximum 8 weeks. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Target Diseases
measure.description: Target diseases for this study were anaerobic infection, infectious enterocolitis, amebic dysentery, and the infection with both infectious enterocolitis and amebic dysentery.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR)
outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion in a participant who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion. A serious ADR was an ADR resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was assessed by the physician.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and had received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion at least once.

group.title: ANAEMETRO Intravenous Infusion (Metronidazole)
group.description: Participants who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of maximum 8 weeks. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR)
measure.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion in a participant who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion. A serious ADR was an ADR resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was assessed by the physician.
measure.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and had received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion at least once.

outcome.title: Clinical Response Rate
outcome.description: Clinical response of ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion was evaluated comprehensively at the completion of the observation period, being assessed as "effective," "not effective," or "indeterminate" by the physician based on clinical symptoms. Clinical response rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants evaluated as "effective" over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI.
outcome.population: The clinical efficacy analysis set comprised of participants from the safety analysis set, excluding those with no information of clinical response or infections other than target disease. Participants evaluated as “indeterminate (n=12)” were excluded from the calculation.

Clinical response rate, which was defined as the percentage of participants evaluated as "effective" over the total number of assessable effectiveness analysis population, was presented along with the corresponding 2-sided 95% CI. Participants assessed as "effective" by the following target diseases were counted to assess whether they contribute to the clinical response: anaerobic infection, infectious enterocolitis, amebic dysentery, and the infection with both infectious enterocolitis and amebic dysentery.
outcome.population: The clinical efficacy analysis set comprised of participants from the safety analysis set, excluding those with no information of clinical response or infections other than target disease. Participants evaluated as “indeterminate (IND)” were excluded from the calculation.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of adverse events. The same event may appear as both an adverse event and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as non-serious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both serious and non-serious events during the study.

group.title: ANAEMETRO Intravenous Infusion (Metronidazole)
group.description: Participants who received ANAEMETRO Intravenous infusion as indicated in the approved local product document were observed for a period of maximum 8 weeks. The dosage can be adjusted as per physician’s discretion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
